units.title: Vitronectin coating of plates
units.text: Coat six-well plates with diluted vitronectin solution (1:100 dilution with DPBS, 1 ml per well) and incubate the plate at room temperature for 1 h.
units.rationale: Provides a defined extracellular matrix for hiPS cell attachment before transduction.

units.title: Lentiviral transduction of hiPS cells
units.text: Aspirate the medium from each well and replace it with 1 ml of pre-warmed E8 medium supplemented with 5 μg ml−1 polybrene and the empirically determined volume of lentivirus encoding the sgRNA library.
units.rationale: Delivers the sgRNA library into hiPS cells while enhancing infection efficiency.

units.title: AggreWell plate preparation
units.text: Add 500 μl of anti-adherence rinsing solution to a well of a new AggreWell plate and incubate the plate for 5 min at room temperature.
units.rationale: Prevents organoid adhesion to the plate, facilitating uniform spheroid formation.

units.title: Dislodging neural spheroids
units.text: Add 1 ml of pre-warmed E8 medium across the entire surface of the well to dislodge any remaining neural spheroids.
units.rationale: Ensures complete recovery of spheroids before downstream processing.

units.title: Organoid dissociation for screen
units.text: Pool 12 organoids into one well of a six-well plate along with 3 ml of enzyme solution with papain (10 U ml−1). Incubate the plate with organoids at 37 °C for 15 min in a 5% CO2 incubator.
units.rationale: Generates a single‑cell suspension suitable for FACS and sgRNA enrichment analysis.

units.title: Assembly of forebrain assembloids
units.text: Transfer one hCO and one hSO into the same well of a 24-well low-attachment plate by using the P1000 pipette tips with wide orifice. Fill each well with 2 ml of NM.
units.rationale: Creates a fused hFA that models interneuron migration between ventral and dorsal forebrain regions.

units.title: Medium change for assembloids
units.text: Change the medium for the hFA every 4 d by replacing 2 ml of NM.
units.rationale: Maintains nutrient supply while minimizing disturbance of the assembled organoids.

units.title: Separation of hFA components
units.text: Transfer one hFA into a 10-cm dish. Aspirate the medium as much as possible.
units.rationale: Prepares the assembloid for physical separation of hCO and hSO prior to downstream analysis.

units.title: Seeding of nucleofected cells
units.text: Add 5 μl of the cell suspension to one well and the rest to another well of a six-well plate.
units.rationale: Allows controlled plating density for recovery after nucleofection.

units.title: Nucleofection execution
units.text: Place the Nucleocuvette strips with closed lid into the retainer of the 4D-Nucleofector X unit. Check for proper orientation of the Nucleocuvette strips. Start the nucleofection process by using the CA137 program.
units.rationale: Delivers RNP complexes into hiPS cells with optimized electrical parameters.
